summary: This document records a call with Dr. Lisa Rocchio, who provides expert analysis on perpetrator behavior patterns, noting that perpetrators often befriend families to gain access and that female perpetrators are more likely to use manipulation and coercion rather than violence.

persons.name: Lisa Rocchio
persons.context: Dr. Lisa Rocchio provides expert analysis on perpetrator behavior patterns during a call, discussing how perpetrators befriend families and noting differences in tactics between male and female perpetrators.

events.title: Expert consultation call with Dr. Lisa Rocchio
events.description: A call was conducted with Dr. Lisa Rocchio to discuss perpetrator behavior patterns, including how perpetrators befriend families to gain access and the tendency of female perpetrators to use manipulation and coercion rather than violence.

keyFacts: Dr. Lisa Rocchio provided expert analysis on perpetrator behavior patterns.
She noted it is common for perpetrators to befriend families to insinuate themselves, increasing access and decreasing red flags.
She stated that female perpetrators are generally more likely to use manipulation and coercion instead of violence.
